turns.speaker: user

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Based on your symptoms (fatigue, headaches, excessive thirst, and frequent urination), it's possible you have diabetes. I recommend you consult with a doctor as soon as possible to get your blood glucose levels checked. This is the best course of action.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that's a bit scary, but good to know. I'll do that. But if it is diabetes, what should I expect in terms of lifestyle changes? Will I have to completely change how I eat? What if I don't want to?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: The extent of lifestyle changes depends on the type and severity of diabetes. For many, dietary adjustments, increased physical activity, and medication are necessary. Specific dietary changes often involve controlling carbohydrate intake and focusing on whole foods. I suggest you wait for your doctor's advice and then ask him/her these detailed questions.
